alert.note: Alert for Lake (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 21 at 7:36PM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding as well as numerous rockslides caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central California, including the following county, Lake. * WHEN...Until 1030 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 736 PM PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 0.7 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.2 to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. Numerous rockslides have been observed along I20. Additional slides in the area will possible with the additional rainfall tonight. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lakeport, Middletown, Upper Lake, Clearlake, Konocti Bay, Glenhaven, Hough Springs, and North Lakeport. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
